Tracy RE-ENTERS.              Nathaniel Hawthorne wrote in The Scarlet Letter: `No man for any considerable period can wear one face to himself and another to the multitude, without finally getting bewildered as to which may be the true.' Robbie puts down the paper, ignoring the jeers.  I am not bewildered! Jessica Riley is my soulmate. She's the one! I know it to be true, and so now do the multitude. Multitudes?  No, multitude.  I have marked myself with this Scarlet J, Jessica! For you. Because your name starts with a J. It's just tape and construction paper but one day I will get a permanent tattoo when I'm old enough that my parents won't freak out on me.  You like the scaffold? It has wheels. Took four weeks to build it. Oh, those are my friends, they helped me wheel it down. Wave hello. 65.  You'll learn to love me. I promise.  Just because I'm four years younger than you?  No. You can't. I've checked. No boyfriend since ninth grade. No date for Spring Formal last  Who is he?  Do I know him? Is he from town?  I'll kill him if he hurts you. Jessica tries not to smile.  We should probably get the scaffold back on the road before dark.  Yeah.  Hi, Nanna!  So you're seeing Mom tomorrow, huh? At my parent-teacher thing?  First time in a while.  Nothing. It's just... there's this girl. Cal smiles.  I like Pringles. This girl's my soulmate. I'm like crazy, stupid, in love with her. And she wants someone else.  Yeah.  Why not?  You did. Cal freezes.  Mom was yours, right?  Listen, Dad. I love you. I have your back, always. But let's be honest here: the woman told you she wanted a divorce and you jumped out of a car.  You're the same guy. You just have different clothes. Do you still love her?    We are. Your son is in desperate need of some romantic inspiration. So set an example for your boy. Don't give up. It's complicated? Uncomplicate it. She says no? Change her mind. Look at you, you're the man right now, Dad. Get her back. Get back my mom. 69.  at top of the stairs, regarding the flowers.  Sure.  She still won't talk to you? 94.  No, I mean, Mom.  What happened?  Dad's here. Tracy's face drops.  I have to blindfold you.  Relax, Mom. He's your husband, not Al Queda. You'll make it out alive. She can't help but smile. She kneels down, allowing Robbie to BLINDFOLD HER from behind. He ties a SCARF around her eyes. Then ANOTHER at a different angle, double-knots it. Then ANOTHER!  Okay, we're good, let's do this.    Hey, Nanna.  Is that Jessica? BAM! Bernie lands a solid right into Cal's jaw.  Know what?   I'm TRYING!  With who?  Are you pointing at him?    You made him dirty pictures? Oh God. 105.    Go home, Dad. Cal NODS, EXITS.   Thank you, Mrs. Thompson. Welcome, Class of 2011. I wasn't really sure what I wanted to talk about today. Mrs. Thompson said it might be good to talk about growing up and getting older and stuff. So I guess I'll talk about that. Cal watches, concerned. Where's his son?  I grew up a lot this year, I think. I used to think that growing up meant really growing. Like getting taller and bigger. But now I think that growing up just makes you smaller. Your dreams get smaller, and what you want gets smaller...  I grew an inch and a half this year, but I feel a lot smaller. Cal sits forward, getting increasingly concerned.  I was in love. And I know that makes parents laugh because I'm only thirteen but whatever, I was. 115.  I believed that there was one true love for everyone, and if you fought for that person, your one true love would always work out. But that's not how it works. It sounded good when I was younger, but... it's just not how it works. There's no such thing as one true love for everyo--  Dad?    I was wrong, Dad. The crowd reacts  as Robbie continues. Cal stands back and smiles. His boy is back.     It was nice of you to come.  So, how are things with your dad? 119.  Yeah, probably a good idea. You were a good baby-sitter, Jessica. I'm sorry if I made you uncomfortable. He holds out his hand, to shake, formally.  I'm not. But I figure: you like my dad, and one day I'll look like my dad, so I'll just come for you then. Jessica smiles.

description: Cal (Steve Carell) and Emily (Julianne Moore) have the perfect life together living the American dream... until Emily asks for a divorce. Now Cal, Mr Husband, has to navigate the single scene with a little help from his professional bachelor friend Jacob Palmer (Ryan Gosling). Make that a lot of help...—Anonymous
